title: Stripped of portfolios, NCP minister Manikrao Kokate no stranger to row: Rummy trouble to housing scam
Netflix’s biggest English series was rejected by all studios; was turned down in 2 minutes: ‘We only saw blank faces’
Rapid weight loss, advised more rest: Yashasvi Jaiswal's health update | Exclusive
description: India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal is recovering from acute gastroenteritis after being hospitalised during Mumbai’s Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match in Pune. The left-hander suffered rapid weight loss of 2.5 kg and has been advised complete bed rest for 7–10 days. His availability for Mumbai’s early Vijay Hazare Trophy matches remains uncertain, with the BCCI medical team monitoring his recovery.

description: The Congress was at the second spot with 60 zones, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) at the third position with 39 zones, BJP 4, BSP 3 and Independents 10, as per the results

Bengaluru vs Wildlife: When a growing city meets the forest
description: Increasing urbanisation, metro construction, rising traffic, and pollution are pushing wildlife out of their natural spaces, and leading to more conflicts and injuries in Bengaluru.

title: I’m not ambitious, just want to stay alive': Nvidia CEO reveals what he fears
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, despite leading a $4.4 trillion company, lives in constant fear of bankruptcy, working seven days a week. He revealed on The Joe Rogan Experience that his mantra is to run Nvidia as if it's "30 days from going out of business," a mindset forged by past near-death experiences.

description: Skipper Suryakumar Yadav and his deputy Shubman Gill are battling challenges of their own with less than two months to go for the T20 World Cup

Dhurandhar box office day 14: Ranveer film slows; Avatar advance buzz
description: 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, with its second weekend surpassing the first and becoming the biggest second weekend grosser, even beating 'Pushpa 2'. The film has now crossed Rs 674 crore worldwide, surpassing 'Baahubali's lifetime collection. Domestically, it has reached Rs 440.78 crore, though a slowdown is now evident as 'Avatar Fire And Ash' gains momentum.

title: Amitabh Bachchan cites astrology behind grandson Agastya Nanda’s Ikkis delay, fan asks if he has seen Dhurandhar yet
ICAI CA Admit Cards for January 2026 exam out: Download hall-tickets for Inter, Final exams at eservices.icai.org
Airline’s focus now on resilience, root cause analysis, rebuilding: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers
Jake Paul vs Tommy Fury scripted claims resurface amid Anthony Joshua allegations
description: Jake Paul is facing fight-fixing claims once again. This time, the allegations surround his December 2025 bout against Anthony Joshua. Deontay Wilder made these claims, prompting a legal threat from Paul. Previously, a leaked document suggested a fixed outcome for his fight against Tommy Fury. The promoters debunked the rumors. Both Paul and Joshua now have denied that the Joshua fight is fixed.

title: G RAM G Bill gets LS nod: What is it - and why is opposition protesting
description: Lok Sabha passed the Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill, replacing MGNREGA with a 125-day wage employment guarantee for rural households. Opposition protested, calling it an attack on Gandhi's legacy and accusing the government of undermining rural development. Supporters claim it will boost villages and deter corruption.

title: Bondi Beach shooter’s India trail: Sajid Akram visited Hyderabad 6 times since 2001
description: Investigations into the Bondi beach attack reveal alleged shooter Sajid Akram's six visits to Hyderabad were personal, focusing on family and property. Indian authorities found no suspicious activity or overseas links during his trips. Preliminary findings suggest any radicalization of Sajid and his son Naveed occurred abroad, with Australian agencies probing further details.

title: ‘Parveen wasn’t the only reason’: Kabir Bedi on strained bond with daughter Pooja and how they reconciled; therapist on parent-child rifts
India's hiring story in 2025 was less about speed, more about skills
description: India’s job market ended 2025 with strong but disciplined growth, as hiring rose 23% year-on-year before moderating in the second half, according to Foundit data. Employers prioritised productivity, leadership, and digital skills, while Tier-2 cities gained prominence. The outlook for 2026 points to steady, skills-led hiring across sectors and geographies.

title: Ghaziabad woman goes to collect rent from tenants, found dead in suitcase
description: A Ghaziabad woman was tragically found dead in a suitcase under a bed in her rented flat. She had reportedly gone to collect overdue rent from her tenants, a couple who have since been detained. The discovery was made by her domestic help after the victim failed to return home. Police are investigating the motive and cause of death.

title: Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy winners list: Jharkhand, Haryana eye maiden title in SMAT 2025 final
Portraits of US Presidents at White House: Trump adds plaques mocking Biden, Obama
description: President Trump has installed bronze plaques under presidential portraits at the White House, featuring his personal, often critical, commentary on predecessors. Many inscriptions, reportedly penned by Trump, label Joe Biden "the worst President in American History" and Barack Obama "one of the most divisive political figures," reflecting his efforts to customize the White House with his opinions.

title: Google Pay rolls out Flex, a UPI-linked digital credit card for daily expenses
Squinting gestures: Row erupts over Finland MPs mocking posts; PM Petteri Orpo apologises
description: Finland's Prime Minister Petteri Orpo has apologized to Japan, China, and South Korea after several Finns Party MPs posted offensive squinting gestures on social media. The actions, intended to support a former Miss Finland, have drawn widespread condemnation and impacted international collaborations. The Prime Minister's office stressed that these actions do not represent Finland's official stance on equality and inclusion.

title: Ammakai replaces Bastian Bandra, here’s what to expect at Shilpa Shetty–Ranjit Bindra’s new restaurant
Growth over 8%! PM Modi highlights Indian economy in Muscat; set to sign India-Oman FTA
description: Prime Minister Modi highlighted the historical depth of India-Oman trade ties at the India-Oman Business Forum, emphasizing deeper economic collaboration ahead of a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA). The CEPA aims to boost bilateral trade beyond $10 billion by offering duty-free trade and removing barriers, positioning Oman as a strategic gateway for Indian businesses.

title: IND vs SA: 'Stop winter cricket in North India' - Shukla sounds alarm after Lucknow T20I
description: A thick blanket of smog forced the abandonment of the India-South Africa T20I in Lucknow, prompting the BCCI to reconsider winter scheduling in North India. Vice-president Rajeev Shukla called the air pollution an "emergency," signaling a potential policy shift. Concerns over player safety and hazardous AQI levels led to the match's cancellation, with a series decider now set for Ahmedabad.

title: Viral video: Father’s calm reaction to daughter’s 11-year ‘intercaste’ relationship confession gains online praise
Bombay High Court gets bomb threat, premises vacated
Govt eases visa processes for foreign professionals, engineers needed by Indian firms
Delhi-NCR, UP Schools closed due to winter pollution; check state-wise updates
Trump’s Gold Card finds no takers? $1 mn visa scheme sees muted interest
description: US President Trump's $1 million "Gold Card" visa program is facing a lukewarm reception in India. Wealthy Indians are reportedly shying away due to a lack of clarity on permanent residency and citizenship pathways. Instead, the established EB-5 investor visa,  remains the preferred route for aspiring Americans.

IPL auction: KKR’s mystery pick Kamra mirrors Chakravarthy, impresses Nayar - Exclusive
description: KKR’s Rs 30-lakh signing Daksh Kamra is already drawing comparisons with Varun Chakravarthy for his mystery spin and similar bowling patterns. The 22-year-old Haryana all-rounder, who clocks 95–97 km/h googlies and packs power-hitting ability, has impressed coaches and scouts, including Kumar Sangakkara and Abhishek Nayar, after a rapid rise through the under-23 ranks.

Ashes: 'Worst technology ever' — Starc slams Snicko as fresh controversy erupts
description: The snickometer faced intense scrutiny during the third Ashes Test after controversial decisions involving Alex Carey and Jamie Smith.  Australian bowler Mitchell Starc branded the technology "the worst ever" after Smith was reprieved despite a visible glove movement.  Further confusion arose when Snicko later ruled Smith out, highlighting its unreliability.

The easy money trail | Kabaddi, music, hawala: What connects gangsters and extortion in Punjab
IND vs SA: 'No cricket...AQI 411' - Tharoor’s stinging post after Lucknow T20I is lost to smog
description: The fourth T20I between India and South Africa in Lucknow was abandoned without a ball bowled due to persistent fog and poor air quality. Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor criticized the venue selection, highlighting the hazardous AQI and suggesting Thiruvananthapuram as a better alternative. Player welfare concerns were amplified as Hardik Pandya was seen wearing a mask during warm-ups.

title: 7 years on, OBC list still to get Parliament's stamp
Delhi 50% WFH: Why it may be easier said than done
description: Delhi's 50% work-from-home directive under GRAP has caused confusion among office-goers, with many unaware or unsure of its implementation. While some firms are adapting, smaller businesses cite manpower and resource limitations, leaving the actual impact and enforcement uncertain.

title: Goa nightclub fire probe: Cops term Luthras flight risk; Mapusa court turns down duo’s demand for mattress
description: Owners of Birch by Romeo Lane, where 25 died in a fire, were remanded in five-day police custody. Goa police sought custody to uncover financial transactions, prevent further illegal operations, and identify associates. The Luthra brothers had fled India after the incident but were arrested upon their return.

title: Shocker! 27,397 births in 3 months in a village of 1,500
description: A Yavatmal village with 1,500 residents registered an astonishing 27,397 births in three months, triggering alarm bells for a massive cyber fraud. The village's Civil Registration System ID was found mapped in Mumbai, with most registered individuals reportedly from other states. Authorities have launched a thorough investigation and are canceling the suspicious entries.

title: With shrinking wetlands, rising climate risks, is Chennai ready for the next flood?
description: Chennai's vulnerability to floods was highlighted again as heavy rains submerged parts of the city, causing damage and disruption. Despite significant investment in stormwater drains, experts warn that encroachments on canals and rivers, along with desilting issues, continue to impede water flow, leaving the city at risk.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
description: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5% of its Luxembourg workforce, impacting software developers as the company embraces AI. This reduction follows a global layoff of 14,000 employees and comes after negotiations resulted in a reduced number from the initial plan. Despite the cuts, Amazon reaffirms Luxembourg as a strategic European partner.
